page.title: 05VILLAGE OF MARSTON MEYSEY
page.content: A{Wiltshire}village either side of a through road, "The Street", surrounded by cereal producing farmland, pasture for cattle and horses, and an airfield. The sixty houses range from large country houses ("The Manor" and "The Grange") to {Cotswold}style cottages, and include twelve council houses, four old people's bungalows, some infilling houses of reconstituted {Cotswold}stone, and, increasingly, conversions of barns/stables to dwelling houses. There is a church, a former school used as a village hall, an inn ("The Spotted Cow and Calf") and a garage doing repair work, but there is no shop - the Post Office/General store having shut down upon the death of the owner. Private transport is essential as there is limited public transport.
